title: If a champion's rework in a class update fails, are they automaticly thrown into the VGU list?
body: Riot has said that Skarner and Morde both failed when reworked, and they are now thrown into the VGU group. So is this going to be a trend where failing the update means the champion is sent back to the drawing board or is this more of a case by case like thing?

It is minor in comparison to full reworks, but when you consider that his Q, W, and E are all mechanically different to how he was played, to the player it is a major rework. Morde players before the update were used to going in and relying on using aoe damage to get his shield up, and using W to keep his shield up in between Q and E. 

Now in comparison you are required to build health to get a larger shield. If you build health and tank you get no more than a {{item:3116}} {{item:3157}} which is 200 ap. With the rest of your items comprising of {{boots}} with a combination of anything that can give you armor, magic resist, and health. (Being that nuke mage and nuke ad don't work well on him) 
__________________________________________________________________________________________

Just to go through a standard fight. 

Starting with Q, Your Q counts as an auto attack/ spell, I've noticed that off of the first two hits you only get the magic damage in shield, and then the third one doesn't apply on hit effects (like hydra) but you get the full 3rd hit in shield. 

(Assuming 200 ap) That shield from Q is roughly 200 damage in shielding. (25% of low damage means almost no shield.)

W, is only usable alone for the quick double cast, again unless a teammate is nearby, which is when Morde feels (most) balanced. If you were to hit 4 enemy's with Morde's W, which is again when he feels best, with only 200 ap it hits for 1000 damage. 25% of 1k is a 250 damage in shielding, which if you hit 3 minions and 1 champion you get 312 HP in healing. (Which is a nice bonus)

But here is the problem with both of those abilities, Q while giving you higher damage is almost impossible to get off without the use of flash (Slow base speed, combo'd with possibly only a rylis) and then it blocks almost no damage, while dealing minimal damage. Meanwhile W Deals a good chunk of AOE damage, but in anything but an optimaly large block of enemies gives almost no real shielding. In other words on a tank build, with these two items, you get roughly 712 bonus health of shielding from these two skills. 

Now here is where the real bread and butter comes into play. E gives (with 200 ap) ~ 68 shield, and if it is an enemy champion it gives another 250 (since a full hp build with the two items mentioned above gives roughly 1000 possible shield) 

That means that if you hit an enemy with everything but your ulti, you get a whopping 718 shield with 312hp, making your total bonus hp 1030.

____________________________________________________________________________________

Now ignoring his ulti, all of that sounds super great! You have roughly 5k HP, with a good chunk of armor, and magic resist, but here is where the real downfall hits. All of your stuff is down for at least 5 seconds. You have no way of chasing, no way of running, and even if they are within melee range, you have no ability to do anything but auto attack and wait for cool downs. 

Currently a standard ADC (full crit, with mortal reminder) deals ~500 or more damage per hit at 2 hits per second. That is 1000 damage per second. Just standing there you have 10 auto attacks to live through while you have no option other to stand there and take their damage. Which is if anyone can do the math, 5000 damage. On top of that, if they hit you with mortal reminder first, there goes some of that nice healing you got.

All of that above was with better than a 1v1 scenario. You hit minions with your W to get a larger shield, and with building juggernaut you did a whopping 1400-1500 damage in one full combo (not enough to kill someone). That is also only IF, **IF** you hit your third Q. So to kill them you have to manage to live through that  5 second window to get another full cast off, and if you live it was probably only because the enemy got worried about you killing them and ran away, just to reengage. 
_____________________________________________________________________________________

Now what happened differently with old morde? Well, unless they had a dash, you used W to kite them and slow them down (with rylis), by staying as close to them as you possibly could. What happens now? You try to kite with E, and you never get back in range of W. 

I really think you underestimated how much having a solo W was worth in fights. I actually kind of wonder why you don't allow morde to have his (fully) solo cast W back, because between his higher base movement speed, his Q bouncing mechanic, and his aoe W he was better able to keep up with the enemy, or even just solo clear things and objectives. 

Instead of removing some of his flaws, you just made them worse, and then added new ones on top of it. Honestly, if you wanted him to be in a good spot right now, you would allow him to have a higher base movement speed, and a fully self casting W. His aoe damage on W allows him to stay in trades longer, and a slightly higher movement speed would make him more reliable to get his third strike off. It wouldn't be quite as feast or famine.

I don't think the Skarner update failed. The only thing you guys need to change is his Towers.

Make his towers work like wards. Skarner places them around the map as his trinket, follows max ward limit. Whichever team has them captured has vision of that area until another team captures the point. When Skarner places down a ward, it initially begins as a neutral point, like how they initially spawn on the map now. This way, Skarner can't just throw down his pad and instantly get a boost, while at the same time rewarding smart placement and objective control.

This would allow Lane Skarner to be a thing, while keeping Jungle Skarner intact.

Also, do not allow both teams to see the points when laid down. Treat them like Rek'Sai's tunnels. Only become visible through FoW after passing in vision range.

-Edit-

As for Morde, yes, I would agree his rework failed. A solo-lane tankmage was turned into a support. Who is now taken into bot lane with Blitzcrank instead of an ADC, and just 100-0's the enemy adc and wins the teamfights 6v4.

Shouldn't you want to have vision in places you want to fight?

Anywhere that we ward in a match is either for objective control, or to prevent being attacked by unseen opponents, or to attack opponents unseen. If Skarner could have 3 Spires out at a time like wards, wouldn't he want to place them based on where he needs to keep the pressure on the enemy team, but off his own?

Which would be, surprise surprise, where you should be warding. The only time a Skarner would drop a Spire right in the middle of lane, where you wouldn't want to ward, would be if he was laning, or if a teamfight was brewing in that lane, or if he needed to protect a tower.

If you put a spire anywhere you don't plan to fight/escape in, you're wasting the Spire like you'd waste a ward. Why would you ward an area of no strategic importance, other than to help clear your first camp in the jungle? The Spire is both a ward and more. And it should be treated as such.

They throw them down on useless objectives like Gromp or Golems, or into lane to hop to them. They don't help your team get vision, they only save the selfish player's skin.

The Skarner rework was not a failure in any way shape or form. The only problem was that he was **massively** overbuffed when they released him because the PBE consists of…. yea I'm not going to go over that can of worms. Skarner is currently enjoying a nice 52% avg win rate in Plat. to Challenger. (Dem sources: https://champion.gg/champion/Skarner ). Despite having a rough start at first, he is MUCH better then before the Juggernaught update where he was complete garbo ever since they nerfed Cinderhulk the 1st time around. Yes, he has a somewhat gimmicky mini-game which irked many people, but you soon realize that you become the king of the Jg when you and your team have control of a spire. You instantly become Sanic and feel like you have a Trinity force with the atk. speed buff the spire gives you. This is not including the vision it gives you when you cap it which is a really nice playing Skarner. I could go on and on how the rework was what Skarner needed (and yes it did have some problems, but then again nothing is perfect).

I cannot stay the same for Mordekaiser however and that was just more then just messing with how Mordekaiser was played. It was also poor insight with the following of the Marksmen reworks, and how they attempted to make a Melee caster ADC viable right before they literally **supercharged** the ADC's that Morde had to contend with. 

With this "VGU" group, I'm willing to bet money that Skarner will not be looked at again this season with the intention of seriously reworking him. With Morde I'm less certain because of the mess they made with him. I believe that its up to the community, and how much of an uproar they make. Best case scenario is they will look at him again during the mage rework and change him a bit.
